original_conversation.content: [bitter] Thirty-two years. Thirty-two goddamn years I've been showing up at that factory, and now they tell me it's going to, what, Mexico? Vietnam? [pause] Three months notice, that's what we get. Like that's enough time to just... figure out a whole new life. [anxious] I'm fifty-seven years old, what am I supposed to do now? [sigh] Start over? Learn, uh... learn computers or something? [sarcastic] Oh sure, I'll just waltz into some tech company with my high school diploma and my bad back. [very sad] You know, my dad worked at that same factory for forty years. Retired with a pension, a gold watch, the whole thing. And I thought—well, I thought I'd do the same. [pause] My mortgage isn't even paid off yet. Sarah's still got two years of college left. [shaky voice] I keep doing the math and, um... the numbers just don't work. Severance package, unemployment, it's maybe... maybe six months if we're careful. [very melancholic] And then what? Hmm. Who's gonna hire someone my age? [bitter] Everything I know how to do, they can get someone overseas to do for a tenth of the price. [trailing off] I don't even know who I am without that job...

subject: Your bread-winning job at the factory is moving overseas in three months and you're too old to start over
